alert.note: Alert for Socorro (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 26 at 5:10PM MDT until September 26 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Socorro county along and surrounding the Rio Grande. * WHEN...Until 815 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 510 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.75 and 2.5 inches of rain are estimated to have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bosque Del Apache Refuge, San Antonio, Laborcita and Luis Lopez. - This includes the following highways... Highway 380 between Mile Markers 1 and 7. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 131 and 133. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 121 and 144. - http://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood
info.instruction: Arroyos, streams, and normally dry rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes. Water in arroyos can travel many miles and take hours to reach your location from upstream rain areas.
